result.execSummary:
The defendant James L Hoskins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 1 day credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended to be at the Agent's discretion.
No violent contact with any family members.
No contact with Wyatt H. (10/08/2000)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James L Hoskins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Terminated - Obligations satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant James L Hoskins in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Withheld sentence for 12 months Probation - 1 day credit if revoked
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended to be at the Agents discretion. No violent contact with any family members. No contact with Wyatt H. - DOB:  10/08/2000
filed by the State.
